content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-076-13-A |Item_parent=Alcohol dependence |Item_parent_short=Alcohol dependence |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the basic principles of primary prevention of alcohol misuse |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=13}} Objective: to prevent or delay the first use of psychoactive substances, in particular by acting on early use. - Takes into account the person rather than the substance - Frees itself from any judgmental or stigmatising attitude. The main tools are information and education for future users, to reduce risk factors and promote healthy behaviour.

properties.question: What is the primary goal of primary prevention of alcohol misuse?
properties.option_a: To reduce the number of people who become alcohol dependents
properties.option_b: To increase the number of people who become alcohol dependents
properties.option_d: To educate users about the risks of alcohol misuse
